title: Sahulan Cave
content: After Alisadr cave, Sahulan Cave is lran’s second big lake cave, as if it is its smaller model. This cave is located near Sahulan village at 40km distance from Mahabad city. As this cave is the home to so many doves having their nests there, locals have called it Sahulan, meaning “nest of a dove.” In Sahulan Cave, there are seen two lakes that are connected by narrow waterways. The depth of water in the corner of the cave reaches down to about 30m. The height of the cave main corridor reaches about 50m. in this cave, one can see a diversity of cave deposits, most of which are the stalactites and stalagmites and cauliflower-like deposits.

gallery.caption: SE8-1 :Mosses (bryophytes) growing due to illumination with warm lights
SE8-2 :The very high ceiling of Sahulan cave main hall
SE8-3 :A rare species of spongy stalactites in Sahulan cave
SE8-4 :Sahulan cave beautiful lake to host so many tourists
